synopsis: In episode #12 of PBR, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome the talented musician Valante, who shares his journey from a unique communal upbringing to navigating life's challenges and finding solace in creativity. The conversation dives deep into themes of existence, vulnerability, and the beauty of simply being, all while weaving in humor and heartfelt moments.
quotes: If you want to make the world a better place, take a look at yourself and make a change.
I think it can also be very dangerous to feel like, oh, I found this new thing I want to integrate. So now I have to do that all the time.
Life needs to happen for a while in order for me to have something to express.
I always felt very safe and taken care of by all older people around me.
It’s a fine line between survivor's guilt and a savior complex.
I remember sitting in my car, it was raining, and I listened to you guys and I cried.
I could just lay on the bed and be like, why doesn’t everybody just lay on the bed? This is the greatest thing ever.
You can really change the world in small ways, I believe.
Your music is perfect for existing.
